The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rock surfaces or in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, called gemmae, are produced in specialized leaf-like structures called gemma cups. Batrachium sphaerospermum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
